poem:
Title: "War Notes from a Winter Morning"

In the shiver of dawn, Kyiv pleads –
gone, gone, to safer sanctums be wed.
Shadows play war chess; pawns bleed.
An eye, sky-hungry, wanders far, led 
by drone whir. Russia flinches in sleep, 
a bear caught in the wasp's sharp creep.
Davos echoes, 'Help, or let peace seep.'
My pen inks snow - white, deep, cheap.
